Louisville_Jefferson_County.Union Station (Louisville): The Union Station of Louisville, Kentucky is a historic railroad station that serves as offices for the Transit Authority of River City, as it has since mid-April 1980 after receiving a year-long restoration costing approximately $2 million. It was one of three union stations in Kentucky, the other two being in Paducah and Owensboro. It was one of three stations serving Louisville, the others being Central Station and Southern Railway Station.
